name: NEW YORK YACHT CLUB 30

images.alt: New York Yacht Club 30 photo on sailboatdata.com
New York Yacht Club 30 drawing on sailboatdata.com

notes: With a waterline length of 30'', this was the smallest of the Universal Rule-influenced one-design classes built for members of the New York Yacht Club. As a class, it was active into the early 1930's. Into the 21st century, a number of the original boats have been restored to a very high standard.
